description: A school comedy taking place in Tokyo in 2034. Copihan is a joint project of Gonzo and Kei, the illustrator of the manga version of Copihan who is best known for Hatsune Miku.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Vocal Synth
tags.description: Features one or more singers or characters that are products of a synthesize singing program. Popular examples are Vocaloids, UTAUloids, and CeVIOs.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

title.native: こぴはん -沙弥と沙遊の大作戦-

node.description:
[Official Website](http://5pb.jp/shimodaasami/) | [Profile ](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/813/) | [Blog](https://asaponmax.fc2.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shimoda_asami)

Asami Shimoda is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer. She released her first mini album in 2010. Two years later, she released "Awake", her debut maxi single, which was released under 5pb. records. She is affiliated with Arts Vision.

Shimoda's voice samples were used to create Kagamine Rin and Len from Crypton Future Media's Character Vocal Series.

__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Height:__ 150.3 cm
__Hobbies and Abilities:__ fashion, shopping, memorization
__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=169) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rumirumi_81pro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rumirumi_81/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/rumiokubo/) | [Web Diary](http://gree.jp/ookubo_rumi) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/30941.html) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/OkuboRumi927) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rumi_Okubo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E4%B9%85%E4%BF%9D%E7%91%A0%E7%BE%8E)

She was discovered in 81 Produce's 3rd Seiyuu Audition in August, 2009, becoming one of the seven finalists amongst 1,109 who took initially part and won the excellence prize in the end. She made her debut in a minor role for the anime [Sasameki Koto](https://anilist.co/anime/6203).

(Source: AniDB)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Ami Aiba in "Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth" (VG)
- Arin in "Fairy Fencer F" (VG)
- Elizabeth Bathory in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
- Female Protagonist in "Digimonstory Cybersleuth" (VG)
- Isto in "ToHeart2 Dungeon Travelers 2" (VG)
- Lancer in "Fate/Extra CCC" (VG)
- Little Red Riding Hood in "Kongokutou Mary Skelter" (VG)
- Lunalu in "Granlue Fantasy" (VG)
- Mayuka Morimoto in "Chou Ginga Sendan -Infinity-" (VG)
- Misaki Shinoyama in "Star Horse Pocket" (VG)
- Rider (Astolfo) in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
- Tia in "Goddess of Victory: Nikke" (VG)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

Megurine Luka, codenamed CV03, is a Japanese VOCALOID developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was initially released in January 2009 for the VOCALOID2 engine. She is the third release of Crypton's Character Vocal Series and is a Character Voice VOCALOID.

Her voice is provided by the Japanese voice actress and singer, [Yuu Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95119), who was recorded in Japanese and English for the voicebank.
